rtc:arCoef.description: autoregression coefficient related to prior time step

rtc:alpha1.description: the wind friction coefficient is given by Cw = alpha1 + alpha2 * Vw, with wind velocity Vw

rtc:alpha2.description: the wind friction coefficient is given by Cw = alpha1 + alpha2 * Vw, with wind velocity Vw

rtc:crossSection.description: Cross section in the center of the flow branch.

rtc:roughness.description: Roughness (Chezy) as a function of elevation h

rtc:slope.description: slope for optional kinematic wave branch

rtc:ux.description: optional wind velocity at an elevation of 10 m above the water surface (x-direction), implementation is for the inertial model only

rtc:uy.description: optional wind velocity at an elevation of 10 m above the water surface (y-direction), implementation is for the inertial model only

rtc:accumulation.description: Accumulation of a time series over time

rtc:gradient.description: Post processing for computing gradients of simulated values

rtc:hbv.description: This is an implementation of the HBV-96 hydrological model. Note that the unit hydrograph is not included, but available separately.

rtc:hydraulicModel.description: Simplifications of the full dynamic, one-dimensional hydraulic model according to the kinematic wave, diffusive wave and inertial assumptions.

rtc:hydrologicalModel.description: Modular, conceptual hydrological model with implicit time stepping scheme.

rtc:reservoir.description: Reservoir with arbitrary number of inlets and outlets.

rtc:reservoirCompact.description: Test implementation of a compact reservoir class for simultaneous and sequential optimization mode

rtc:unitDelay.description: Unit delay operator for  delaying a value by n times the time step of the model.

rtc:capacityCharacteristics.description: Maximum capacity of outlet as function of the water level h, minimum capacity is assumed to be zero

rtc:crossSectionTable.description: Tabulated cross section, pairs of elevation h and width b

rtc:roughnessTable.description: Pairs of elevation h and roughness C (according to Chezy)

items.description: Lookup table at a date location

rtc:interpolationOptions.description: Interpolation option BLOCK / LINEAR for the two inputs date and value

rtc:DateRecordComplexType.description:
defined data input as per time series format date time (defined either by dateTime or time or
                month day) and value

rtc:false.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:true.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:false.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:true.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:ElevationTableComplexType.description:
Table containing data for different elevations. Type of element 'value'
                depends on purpose for which table is used.

items.description: Power equation for optional segments with lower and upper water level bounds, y = a*(x+b)^c

rtc:x1SeriesVector.description: reference to time series ID vector

rtc:y.description: time series ID of resulting value

rtc:yVector.description: time series ID vector of resulting value

rtc:TT.description: temperature limit for snow / rain [oC], normally close to 0

rtc:TTI.description: temperature interval with a mixture of snow / rain [oC]

rtc:ALPHA.description: response box parameter [-], usually between 1.0 and 2.0

rtc:PERC.description: percolation from upper to lower response box [mm/day], usually between 0 and 6

rtc:CFMAX.description:
degree day factor [mm/(oC*day)], varies normally between 1.5 and 4, 2 and 3.5 can be used in forested and open
landscape respectively

rtc:BETA.description: parameter in soil routine [-], usually between 1 and 6

rtc:LP.description: limit for potential evapotranspiration [-], in the range between 0.3 and 1

items.description: Flow branches
Hydraulic structures
Storage nodes

rtc:nJac.description: number of evaluations of the Jacobian

rtc:orifice.description: Orifice according to definition in SOBEK-Rural

rtc:weir.description: Weir according to definition in SOBEK-River

items.description: sub-models for the modular setup of the hydrological model, the storage system contains a set of storage nodes and links and is solved with an implicit time stepping scheme

rtc:HDown.description: downstream node, typically UZ unsaturted zone

rtc:HUp.description: upstream node, typically GW upper zone

rtc:EPM.description: monthly mean value of potential evaporation [mm/timestep]

rtc:HDown.description: downstream node, can be GW groundwater or SW surface water

rtc:HUp.description: upstream node, can be GW groundwater or SW surface water

items.description: inflow as discharge [m3/s]

rtc:state.description: unit volume [mm], replaces the computes state

items.description: inflow as unit Volume [mm/timestep]

rtc:HDown.description: downstream node, typically LZ (lower zone storage)

rtc:HUp.description: upstream node, typically UZ (upper zone storage)

items.description: discharges from different storage nodes [m3/s]

rtc:HUp.description: upstream (release) node, typically UZ and/or LZ (upper/lower zone storages)

rtc:HDown.description: optional downstream node, typically uper saturated zones (UZ upper zone storage). Required if capillary flow is used and SM and UZ are present in one storage system

rtc:HUp.description: upstream node, typically unsaturated zone (SM soil moisture)

items.description: infiltation into the unsaturated zone (fluzex into SM  [m3/s])

rtc:HDown.description: downstream node collector of abstracted water. For instance drinking water treatment plant

rtc:HUp.description: upstream node, source of water abstraction/distribution (i.e. surface water/groundwater/sewerage)

rtc:D.description: series of industrial or domestic water demands/abstractions [m3/s]

rtc:HDown.description: downstream node collector of abstracted water. For instance drinking water treatment plant

rtc:HUp.description: upstream node, source of water abstraction/distribution (i.e. surface water/groundwater/sewerage)

items.description: arbitrary number of neurons within one of the layers

rtc:capillaryFlow.description: capillary flow, typically from GW (saturated upper zone - ground water) to UZ (unsaturated zone)

rtc:evaporationActual.description: actual evaporation from unsaturated zone storage node

rtc:evaporationInterception.description: evaporation from interception storage node, typically VEG/P/UP (vegeration/paved interception)

rtc:groundwaterFlow.description: GW Groundwater interaction with SW Surface water

rtc:irrigation.description: NOT REFACTORED. water consumption by domestic irrigation due to dry soil

rtc:meltRefreezing.description: NOT REFACTORED. melting and refreezing, typically used between SP (snow pack) and WC (water content) nodes

rtc:percolation.description: percolation, typically from GW upper zone to GW lower zone), or from UP unpaved surface to UZ unsaturated zone

rtc:releaseInterception.description: release above threshold from interception storage node, typically VEG/P/UP (uses relese above threshold link)

rtc:releaseWaterContent.description: NOT REFACTORED. release from water content storage node (typically WC)

rtc:response.description: response from storage node, typically GW upper and GW lower zone storage nodes

rtc:sewerOverflow.description: sewer overflow (uses relese above threshold link)

rtc:soilRunoff.description: soil runoff from UZ unsaturated zone to GW upper zone storage node

rtc:wasteWaterTreatmentPlant.description: water treated via the WWTP, flows at a max rate of a constant max pump capacity. Uses water distribution constant link

rtc:waterDistributionConstant.description: water abstraction/distribution/consumption referenced to a constant demand (e.i. maxpump capacity). Uses water distribution constant link

rtc:waterDistributionVariable.description: water abstraction/distribution/consumption referenced to a variable demand (e.i. domestic or industrial water demands). Uses water distribution variable link)

rtc:extrapolationOption.description: table interpolation can be BLOCK or LINEAR, default setting if not provided is LINEAR

rtc:interpolationOption.description: table interpolation can be BLOCK or LINEAR, default setting if not provided is LINEAR

items.description: arbitrary number of layers
reference to time series ID
Supply neuron id! This can be any neuron in the network, also the neuron itself and neurons in the following layers. In this case, the output of the last time step is used -> recurrent network

rtc:y.description: result of the summation of weighted input (intermediate result)

rtc:storageCharacteristics.description: Storage characteristics of the node: The storage as a function of water level h. It can be provided as table or as a formula.

rtc:HBC.description: Time series with the water level boundary condition, note that a value MUST be provided at all time steps, otherwise the model stops with an error message

rtc:HUpdate.description: Time series with an optional water level for model updating

items.description: Time series with an inflow bounday condition, note that a value MUST be provided at all time steps
Reference to timeseries in data configuration containg the relative release (values inbetween 0 and 1). (ONLY FOR CONTROLLED OUTLET)

rtc:release.description: Reference to timeseries in data configuration containg an absolute release. (ONLY FOR CONTROLLED OUTLET)

rtc:differentialPart.description: memory of differential part (in fact e of the last time step)

rtc:nJac.description: number of evaluations of the Jacobian

rtc:D.description: distance measure for smoothing the transitions [-]

rtc:IRR_THR.description: Threshold of the downstream node under which irrigation is needed [mm]

rtc:M.description: smoothing factor, default = 0.05, more smoothing for higher value and vice versa

rtc:FRAC.description: percentage of the flow which flows towards the bucket of interest. The permitted range is between 0 and 100

rtc:D.description: smoothing parameter for switching between a linear ramp (D=0.0) and a sigmoid function (D=1.0)

rtc:TT.description: temperature limit for snow and rainfall [oC]

rtc:TTI.description: temperature interval with a mixture of snow and rainfall [K]

rtc:MIN_UP.description: minimum abstraction level upstream [mm]. Default 0, till empty.
minimum abstraction level upstream [mm]. Default 0, till empty.

rtc:ki.description: factor on the integral part ki*integral(e)dt

rtc:kp.description: factor on the proportional part kp*e

rtc:mode.description: pid mode, either "NATIVE" or "SOBEK2" or "PIDPOS" or PIDVEL"

rtc:settingMaxSpeed.description: maximum speed of the actuation in [unit/s]

rtc:false.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:true.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:levelStorageEquation.description: level storage equation according to S = A0 + A1*FB ( + A2*FB^2 + ...)

rtc:levelStorageTable.description: level-storage relation of the reservoir, level in [m] or [ft], storage in [m3] or [KCFS-hrs]

rtc:levelStorageTableExternal.description: externalizes the level storage table to a parameter file, requires the two columns "level" and "storage"

rtc:tailwaterEquation.description: tailwater equation according to TW = A + B*FB_downstream(t-1) + C*Q(t)^D, D is equal 1.0 by default if not provided

rtc:tailwaterExternalTimeSeries.description: external tailwater elevation from an external source or a previous calculation OUTSIDE of the reservoirCompact components

rtc:tailwaterTable.description: tailwater as a function of the reservoir release only

rtc:tailwaterTidalEquation.description: tidal influenced tailwater equation (works only in hindcast mode, use tailwater external with appropiate forecast of the tailwater in operational forecasting), TW = TWObs + A*(Q-QObs)

rtc:turbineEfficiencyTable.description: old formulation, will be removed in the future

rtc:turbineEfficiencyTable2D.description: new formulation, turbine effiency depends on head and turbine release, computation by 2D lookup

rtc:FB.description: forebay elevation [m above reference level] or [ft above sea level]

rtc:OF.description: optional time series with the unit outage factor [0-1], it reduces the (physical) constraints PXValue and QTXValue (NO impact on PX, QTX)

rtc:PM.description: minimum generation constraint on aggregated turbine level [MW], primarly used as operational constraint

rtc:PMValue.description: fixed minimum generation constraint on aggregated turbine level [MW], primarily used as physical constraint

rtc:PX.description: maximum generation constraint on aggregated turbine level [MW], primarly used as operational constraint

rtc:PXValue.description: fixed maximum generation constraint on aggregated turbine level [MW], primarly used as physical constraint

rtc:Q.description: reservoir outflow [m3/s] or [KCFS], data is expected to be complete and valid

items.description: single or multiple inflow time series into the reservoir [m3/s] or [KCFS], data is expected to be complete and valid if provided

rtc:QMISC.description: optional miscellaneous flow (uncontrolled), will be zero by default [m3/s] or [KCFS] if no time series is supplied or if the time series includes NaN values

rtc:QSPercentage.description: relative spill target as a percentage [0..100] of the total flow Q

rtc:QSPercentageValue.description: relative spill target as a percentage [0..100] of the total flow Q

rtc:QTX.description: maximum generation constraint on aggregated turbine level [m3/s] or [KCFS], primarily used as operational constraint

rtc:QTXValue.description: fixed maximum generation constraint on aggregated turbine level [m3/s] or [KCFS], primarily used as physical constraint

rtc:FB.description: forebay elevation [m above reference level] or [ft above sea level]

rtc:R.description: residuum of mass balance (in simultaneous mode) [m3/s] or [KCFS]

rtc:S.description: storage [m3] or [KCFS-hrs], this is the system state needed in the state file

rtc:TW.description: tailwater elevation [m above reference level] or [ft above sea level]

items.description: Controlled outlet, release can be defined by external input or rule

rtc:mode.description: Time integration scheme for the network components

rtc:storageCharacteristics.description: Storage characteristics of the reservoir: The storage S as a function of the water level h can be provided as a table or formula.

rtc:theta.description: Time weighting coefficient for the semi-implicit theta schema: 0 is equal to a full weight on the old time step, 1 represents a full weight on new time step. The coefficient is not used in the fully explicit or implicit schemas. The permitted range is between 0.5 and 1.0.

items.description: Uncontrolled outlet, the release is a function of the water level h in the reservoir

rtc:evaporation.description: Direct evaporation from the reservoir [mm/time step]

items.description: Upstream inflows [m3/s] into the reservoir, can be more than one for aggregation the inflows from several upstream reservoirs or river reaches

rtc:level.description: Optional level [m] for updating the simulated level by an observed water level (simple data assimilation), if provided the error output is equal to the mass balance correction

rtc:precipitation.description: Direct precitation into the reservoir [mm/time step], the value will be multiplied by the current water surface area of the reservoir

rtc:error.description: optional error output [m3/s] which is non-zero if the simple data assimilation option for overruling the simulated water level is used

rtc:relativeStorage.description: relative storage [-] typically between 0 and 1 depending on the definition of the maximum level above]

rtc:residuum.description: optional residuum of the implicit solution

rtc:dischargeRef.description: Reference to timeseries in data configuration

rtc:outputReferences.description: Contains references to the output timeseries in the data configuration

rtc:components.description: The components section includes all simulation components.

rtc:general.description: OBSOLETE. Still here for backwards compatibility. Remove after next release.

rtc:rules.description: The rules section includes operating rules or controllers for defining the release of reservoir, structural settings of gates etc.

rtc:triggers.description: Triggers may activate or deactivate rules defined in the section above.

rtc:dateLookupTable.description: Date lookup table, output y is a function of date and an input value x, the interpolation on the date / value axis can be BLOCK or LINEAR, the number of records should be constant for each date record

rtc:deadBandValue.description: Deadband threshold, yNew will become yOld, if the change yNew-yOld is smaller than the threshold value

rtc:dedicated-Aebi.description: Dedicated rule for the control of Bielersee, Canton Bern, CH

rtc:dedicated-Thunersee.description: Dedicated rule for the control of Thunersee, Canton Bern, CH

rtc:guideband.description: Guide band rule, output get 0 if input less equal xMin, 1 if input greater equal xMax, linear interpolation otherwise xMin and xMax can be a function of date, main application in combination with a relative release of a reservoir outlet

rtc:limiter.description: Limiter for limiting the change of a variable in a time step to a relative (PERCENTAGE) or absolute  (ABSOLUTE) change

rtc:merger.description: Data hierarchy, highest input has highest priority

rtc:unitDelay.description: Unit delay operator for  delaying a value by n times the time step of the model.

rtc:false.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:true.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:defaultInputValue.description: default input value, if input is NaN or infinity

rtc:defaultOutputValue.description: default output, if no combination of the table applies

rtc:false.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:tables.description: number of tables with input, output values, the initial state can be taken into account optionally

rtc:tolerance.description: tolerance for finding a match, keep in mind that the all variable are stored in doubles

rtc:true.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:validPeriods.description: optional period of the year for which the trigger is active

rtc:false.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:true.description: link the trigger event to either an other trigger           or to a rule. Use the item ID as link to rules

rtc:maximumLevel.description: Maximum water level h in the reservoir: this optional value does not limit the water level, it is used however to compute the relative filling percentage of the reservoir according to s = S/S(maximumLevel), where S is the absolute storage volume

rtc:storageEquation.description: Storage equation, storage S = f(water level h)

rtc:storageTable.description: Storage table with pairs of elevation h and storage S

items.description: storage node

rtc:acceptableConvergenceThreshold.description: optional threshold after reaching the maximum number of iterations, writes a warning if reached, writes error otherwise

rtc:convergenceThreshold.description: iteration stops after reaching this threshold

rtc:treatNonConvergenceAsError.description: treat non-convergence related to the thresholds as error or not

rtc:snowRainJunction.description: separates precipitation into snow and rainfall

rtc:storageSystem.description: storage systems with storage nodes and links for setting up bucket models

rtc:TailwaterComplexType.description:
Table containing data for different elevations. Type of element 'value'
                depends on purpose for which table is used.

rtc:ratingCurve.description: Tailwater depending on discharge computed by a rating curve

rtc:FBDown.description: time series reference to forebay elevation of the downstream project, only required if B is non-zero

rtc:interpolationOption.description: table interpolation can be BLOCK or LINEAR, default setting if not provided is LINEAR

rtc:valueOption.description: setting if the control table provides the absolute value or the relative value

rtc:y.description: optional input for deriving the timeActive in case of the relative from Value option

rtc:TimeStepComplexType.description:
The timeunit element has three attributes, unit and devider and multiplier.
            the unit is second, minute, hour, week, month year.
            The divider attribute is optional (default = 1).

rtc:TimeZoneSimpleType.description:
The timeZone (in decimal hours shift from GMT)
            e.g. -1.0 or 3.5. If not present GMT is assumed

rtc:merger.description: Data hierarchy, highest input has highest priority

rtc:polygonLookup.description: trigger with two-dimensional lookup table, trigger results are defined by polygons

rtc:capacityEquation.description: capacity equation of hydropower turbine as a function of the water head

rtc:capacityTable.description: capacity table of hydropower turbine as a function of the water head

rtc:efficiencyTable.description: efficiency table unit power output [MW / m3/s] as function of head [m]

rtc:efficiencyConstant.description: constant efficiency over all discharges, typical range is [0.80, 0.90]

rtc:columns.description: column Ids refering to the head [m] of each column

rtc:maxFlows.description: maximum flow for a given head (provided above)

items.description: rows with turbine efficiency (related to the head coloumn) for a given flow

rtc:relativeRelease.description: provision of relative turbine release, 1 = maximum capacity

rtc:capacityCharacteristics.description: Maximum capacity of outlet as function of the water level h, minimum capacity is assumed to be zero

rtc:nStep.description: nStep optionally provides a delay with an arbitrary numer of time steps or sub time step, i.e. 1.5 time steps, if being used also specify the yFinal tag in the output options

rtc:output.description: The configuration of a multiple unit delay requires the configuration of a time series for each delay time step

rtc:yFinal.description: optional result of the delay operator, identical to yVector[end] if the delay is a multiple of the time step, required in case of sub time steps

rtc:yMean.description: optional mean of input and outputs

rtc:ySum.description: optional sum of input and outputs

items.description: definition of individual time series for vector with delays, configure one element less than weights defined above

rtc:xDelayVector.description: definition of delay vector, configure one element less than weights defined above

items.description: user defined weights

rtc:factor.description: sum of all weight, if not equal to 1.0

rtc:nodeD.description: downstream node which recieves the irrigation water

rtc:nodeU.description: upstream node, source of water usually the drinking water treatment plant

rtc:nodeA.description: auxiliary node with snow pack, typically SP (snow pack)

rtc:timeSeriesType.description:
Type of data, either accumulative or instantaneous.
                        For accumulative data the time/date of the event is
                        the moment at which the data was gathered.
